definition: lit. to squeeze out toothpaste/fig. to extract a confession under pressure
to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)
to moisten/to grease/to apply (cream, ointment)/to dip a brush in ink

sentences.english: He always squeezes toothpaste in the middle of the tube and makes a big noise when eating.
sentences.chinese: 他总是从中间开始挤牙膏，而且吃饭的时候吧唧嘴。

sentences.english: Mickey:Okay. Do you squeeze the toothpaste from the top or the bottom?
sentences.chinese: 好的，那你挤牙膏的时候是从上面还是下面？

sentences.english: Invoid of cumbersome procedure of getting out toothpaste, convenient for anybody.
sentences.chinese: 避免繁琐的挤牙膏过程，适合大众便于使用。

sentences.english: The toothpaste squeezing clamp body can be made into a cylinder or a rectangle.
sentences.chinese: 挤牙膏夹本体，可制成圆柱体或长方体。

definition: to wipe one’s ass/(fig.) (coll.) to clean up sb else's mess
sponge (zoology)/sponge (piece of absorbent material, either natural or made from plastic etc)/foam rubber
to turn over old accounts/fig. to revive old quarrels/to reopen old wounds
lit. to inject chicken blood/(coll.) extremely excited or energetic (often used mockingly)
Turkish toilet/squat toilet/to vacate one's bowels
to drag along/to haul/(fig.) to procrastinate/shilly-shallying/sluggish/(computing) drag and drop/(loanword) tola, unit of weight, approx. 11.664 grams
lit. to blow apart the hairs upon a fur to discover any defect (idiom); fig. to be fastidious/nitpick
